01znMwGJextw2_WIziIRBA.text: We made a second visit. I was very happy (I just want you to WIN!!) because the food is very GOOD! I had the jerk chicken entree, with a side of rice and beans and plantains which I don't believe were fresh, more of the frozen type. (I could be wrong) but were still good. My food was not hot at all. I was so hungry that I didn't bother sending it back. I will say, my companions weren't wowed at all! Service was slow and we waited quite a long time for chips and salsa and even longer for our drinks, which came after the food. There's no such thing as food to-go here either. I left still hungry :(  Something to keep in mind: you have VERY strong competition within close proximity. You can get superb quality, fresh, HOT and nicely portioned meals all day within feet of this restaurant. Rice is fairly inexpensive and I myself, am completely puzzled by the amount that is served, especially if it counts as a side. I also heard another table mentioning that the drinks were subpar compared to another establishment. Please read your reviews and make what adjustments you can. The place was full and lively so that's a good thing. You are such a welcomed addition to this area. I will continue supporting hoping to see further improvements as you grow.

WiBwXh0T8DXuSymqX3XbfA.text: Great experience at Mango's. We visited on a busy Saturday night but had a great experience thanks to the excellent customer service from Adrian, an amazing manager who apparently doubles as a waiter and bartender and anything else that is required to make customers happy. Have been to many places during peak hours and very few can handle the pressure like Adrian while keeling a smile on their face.

kKfYJ1HkEfPd3NPo9iq7eg.text: The service was great! I was scared to order the jerk chicken because most places in this city make it taste like BBQ sauce. My husband got the jerk and it was alright. I got the curry chicken and was impressed by the flavor. My kids had chicken fingers with fries. There was chimichurri on one kid's fries that made my whole life! Mango's needs to stop playing and put chimichurri fries on the menu. No, they just need to offer it with everything on the menu.  Cus: I'll have the roast chicken Svr: with or without chimichurri.

B3-LJnu6Yw3q1ZzeNWv2vg.text: Stumbled on Mango's by accident.  We were going to Haberdish, which is right next door. There was a significant wait, and their bar was full, so we added our names to the             list and decided to go to one of the other bars to wait it out. Mango's  was the first place we passed. Went in and was pleasantly surprised by the menu. My husband is from Trinidad, so to stumble upon a Caribbean restaurant, with such amazing cuisine, was a True find. We loved the Baba Ganoush. My husband had the chicken curry and loved it. I had curried chickpea and veggies, which worked beautifully with my Vegan diet. Service was spot on. We were seated immediately. Love NODA,and this restaurant fits well with the entire scene.

AKOnV91CNqL8ZHbWIExoow.text: OMG...just driving past and decided to stop in. Turned out to be an awesome dining experience. Everything was so authentic and served with love. From the drinks to the entrees we were beyond satisfied. An added plus was the DJ spinning great tunes. Will definitely return...soon!!!

mYp0ICnXvPdHd6E8rFSu0Q.text: Awesome service and food! Will be back! Drinks made me feel like I was on a beach also!

RGOh5yRJ_6U3DPPOyUgrqw.text: It took 40 minutes to get water and chips/salsa. When we asked about our drinks, our waiter told us to relax. That's when we told him to cancel our dinner order. We left and went to a different restaurant.

BGxjLzE_yGVACX_gfaTLhw.text: I've been to Jamaica twice and this place has the MOST authentic jerk I've ever had in the states. Service was great, and the food was AMAZING!!!

Y2P8HvC4WH2ANrxa7PhLwQ.text: Went to celebrate great news with friends on a Saturday night. I needed to make a last minute reservation because my first option fell through, and they were accommodating. My party arrived and the waitress could not have been nicer to us. We explained that two people would not be with us and we went ahead and ordered. After this, the bartender walks over and makes a comment about the rest of the party not being present. My order came with the wrong sides, which was corrected. The food was not good "Caribbean" -- the oxtails were overcooked and tough. I ordered a drink with dinner... never got it, but was okay without it. When the waitress brought my bill, she said "did you ever get your drink?" I said no...and instead of correcting my bill, she brings me a drink and tells me that he said he made it an hour ago...but that that was not True. So, as we are wrapping up...I'm being made to pay for a $10 drink that I ordered before dinner. As friends and I are finishing our drinks, the bartender comes over and asks if we are staying for drinks. When we respond that we would, he said that we could come to the bar because they have a "10-top and needed the tables" we were sitting at.  After this happened, the waitress came over and expressed that that was completely rude and that she had already spoken to the owner. We, however, did not receive any sort of apology.  Food wasn't great, but we were looking for a nice place to have dinner and celebrate good news. The food wasn't that great, and the treatment that we received was even worse.

JVJb5Ip89XpStlpmGxNSpQ.text: Our second visit and it was great.  Service was spot on (Ingrid is fantastic) and the food was delicious.  The menu description does not do it justice.  My wife had the bread with the curry chicken and I had wings and the jerk chicken tacos.    All were fantastic.   Wings were falling off the bone and had a great spice.    We'll definitely be back!

prXuWZnu9r89tu_xsEeYLw.text: We really enjoyed our trip to Mango's this past Sunday! The space was well decorated and there was a lively atmosphere, despite it not being very busy following a big Panthers loss.   Our group was promptly seated and offered menus. We selected drinks, including red and white Sangria on special ($5) and cocktails (~$10). The drinks were good, but a little on the sweet side. We also got chips and salsa, and the chips were fresh and crisp and served in a cute cigar box.   We then ordered entrees including jerk chicken tacos, jerk chicken nachos, chicken empanadas and curry goat. The main reason for the non-five star review was the fact that the food came out at all different times.   The food itself was very flavorful, with the a little bit of heat. Portion sizes were decent for the price, though not large enough for leftovers (I wish! The goat had great flavor and was tender). The only issue was there were quite a bit of bone pieces mixed in with the meat.   The best part of the meal was the service! Our waitress was extremely friendly and accommodating, despite the challenges some of our party threw her way.  We'd definitely be going back soon. Hope word spreads about this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

Y1z_BpapvT7xdeCumqCwlw.text: It was somewhat late when we got to mangos and I work at a restaurant so I understand that towards closing things are not always top notch. The service was a bit slow but pleasant. I got jerk chicken and my boyfriend got curry chicken. We were a bit disappointed to find that only the roasted chicken could be served in a quarter or half. The portion sizes for both of us were small compared to other Caribbean restaurants I've been to and the lighting was extremely dark. The flavor of our meals was good besides the rice and beans which was probably better earlier in the day. It wasn't anything super special but we weren't disappointed because they were open until 2 and near other things to do in the NoDa area.

OCfOpfnqbLS5T07DpK_xWw.text: I love coming here for lunch, they are very affordable and they have good quality food. To make things better, the service is excellent!

IcHihVOc3m9wMIM44i9Kjw.text: Mangos is a nice Caribbean addition to to the NODA area. I ate the jerk chicken and waffles. I got got a cocktail, The Jamaican Thunder. Others in my party ate the jerk wings, Mac & cheese, goat , and cabbage. One person in my party had the mango rum punch. The portions were decent especially compared to the price. This was everyone's first time at the restaurant. We all discussed coming back. The server was very nice and helpful. I will say the waffles were very sweet but when eaten with the spicy jerk chicken they balanced everything out.

9OpImNpXUpIc_lgphquxWw.text: The food was very good, I enjoyed the roasted chicken with plantain and rice and beans. The portions were extremely small compared to other Caribbean restaurants but nonetheless, pretty good.

eYSNr6D9HoFYKX86Xo7lAA.text: Exceptional experience! Good music good vibes and great people. Special Thanks to Randy, he absolutely made our time at Mangos personal and perfect!

5f0vjGusxT5nqXdMsDMj1g.text: Mango's is still in their soft opening phase, so I'll cut them some slack.   Food: I order the chicken and pork tacos. Both were great and decent portion sizes. The chicken tacos had a nice kick to them. We also order the chorizo empanadas and my SO ordered the Classic Chicken with yellow rice, peas, and sweet plantains. The waitress asked him what two sides he wanted so the meal is a TON of food. However, when the plate came out, there were no rice peas or plantains. I asked about this, and the waitress only brought out the plantains. Perhaps there is some confusion if the dish actually comes with two sides or not?   Service was mediocre. We had to ask for waters three times. Also, we got the empanadas after we got our meals even though that was the first thing we ordered.  I'll go back, but I'll give them a couple weeks to sort out the kinks.

I've never been to a restaurant where I only got 4 oxtails, they were good, but I only got FOUR! My partner got the curry goat in the picture it was tasty too, but not as spicy as I would expect curry goat to be... The sides were kinda bland, idk, I would look at this as one of those "Caribbean fusion" restaurants. But overall, it was fine if you don't care about portions! Also if you never really had real Caribbean food, this could be the place for you!

fbjmEpJ2bmd8aZ8q34sjcg.text: My friend, bf and I had dinner here. The wait was short which was great, especially considering the area and it being a Saturday night. I should have used that as a warning.   The menu is very limited.  We ordered chips and salsa to start. They brought out a black bean and corn salsa which I've had at other places and is usually great but not the case here. The salsa is flavorless and the chips are stale with a very off putting aftertaste. After tasting, we did not eat it.   For dinner I had the roasted chicken with beans and rice and plantains. Since I ordered white meat I was expecting a wing and chicken breast, but instead got a chicken wing and the rib cage of a chicken. I mentioned this to our server and they were very nice and brought me a new piece of chicken in a few minutes. The rice was overly aromatic so all I could taste was the herbs and could not actually taste the rice and beans. I will give them credit, the plantains were perfect. My boyfriend got chicken fingers and fries from the kids menu which was your run of the mill frozen chicken fingers and fries you can get at a store. My friend ordered the jerk chicken which she said was ok.   Considering the reviews I expected way more and will say was incredibly disappointed. I will not be returning here. With there being so many great options in the area I can't see how this would ever be someone's first choice.

6h_hb9TZE_8WBZh4FvlNqw.text: As a islander missing home-cooked meals, I was pleasantly surprised that they captured the flavors that take me back to childhood.

85Exh5ByLI6_lxYFezFvLw.text: 1. I should have left when the waiter threw my license down on table after I HANDED it to him.     2. The food is mediocre (if that) ... Go to Caribbean Hut!  3. I continued to watch the rude waiter interact with other guests...he was was moving way too fast and so ready to move on to the next thing that he couldn't truly be attentive to anyone.  You could tell people needed things and were visibly frustrated w/ him disappearing so quickly.  We could never respond to his questions or even say thank you because he would leave so fast. 4. Did I say the food was mediocre?? Seriously, go to Caribbean Hut.  I'm totally fine dealing with subpar customer service if my food is going to be amazing.  You can't have it all, all the time. 5. Back to the rude inattentive waiter... my husband gives him $100 bill to cover the check.  He brings back the change and and literally says thanks while running away... again!  What do we find under the change... the $100 bill.  Unbelievable!

I believe that the cheese sauce was the issue because the jerk chicken nachos would've been great without. Food was good, service fast, drinks top notch, and the music LIVE!!!!

0H8K00J7X_Hjj4RYj4mEiQ.text: As a real Caribbean girl this restaurant was disappointing. before order I jokingly asked the waiter how good was the food, he proceeded to inform me that it was amazing, and that the chef was "straight off the boat". whilst waiting on my food, I asked the couple next to me how was their drinks, they quickly turned up their noses and replied, NASTY! the food was expensive, lacked flavor and seasoning, and basically a sample for the amount I got. definitely has potential, work on portion size and using seasoning.

qYY6gRryqv6T2X_TasvC9w.text: The food is great but the service needs work. The servers were fine, it's the food coming out of the kitchen and the bartenders that are super slow. My two friends ordered drinks and it took forever for them to come to b the table. We got our food before they got their drinks and they ordered those first. I'm also not quite sure if the cooks and chef are paying attention to the orders. My friend ordered curry chicken with green beans and peas and rice. My other friend ordered jerk chicken with green beans and yellow rice. When the plates came, they had mixed vegetables Instead of the green beans. Now the server came out and told my friend they were out of rice and peas but she never came and said they were out of green beans until our plates were on the table. What if someone was allergic to the mixed veggies that the chef put on the plate instead of asking for a substitute. I ordered 2 chicken empanadas, plantains and yellow rice. The empanadas were great. I had a snafu, one of my chicken empanadas was actually vegetable so I sent it back and they corrected it. The plantains were good and the yellow rice didn't have any flavor. It needed seasoning. I added the mixed veggies to it and it made the rice 10x better. The french fries are good. Theyre cooked in garlic. Overall, the food is great but the service is slow so beware.

They enjoyed the jerk chicken and the pork. I'd recommend to give it a try if you're looking for a cute sit down spot that doesn't break the bank!

Z_ZqJxmBKSf5fRzy6BPSgQ.text: the service here was terrible and they didnt prepare my salad like i asked. my friends and i waited thirty minutes to get our order taken and it was an all around sub par experience. the food and atmosphere were good, but the service wasn't good at all. the woman who sat us down forgot about us and i honestly wouldnt go here again

qc7QSufHi7obUOGdu6xHbA.text: Everything is so good and has much flavor! All the sauces are made in house! My drink came in a coconut. Such a good time! The chef comes out with every course and is so friendly! A great addition to NoDa!

OZk5R2VdrGEkV0Q4xyJTIw.text: Let's start with this. The food is great. Everything we ate was cooked to perfection-albeit stingy portions for the price. Not to say that it's easy but their style is all pretty much pre made. Nicely roasted chicken, rice, etc. So it should be pretty easy to keep it all smooth right? Well not in the slightest apparently. We were quickly seated, handed menus and offered drinks. Fifteen minutes later the bartender noticed nobody had brought them to us so he did himself. And took our order after noticing nobody had done so. Food came out and that was the last we heard from anyone there. I stopped a waitress and asked for a second drink. Never got it. Our plates sat empty for a good half hour as staff busily wandered with nothing in hand. We had to beg to get a check and then beg even more to pay it. I hope they get it together. The food was really good. But it won't last long if they don't.

YMvxNs0TUlsuaLYr51yMoQ.text: Overall: Food: Great | Drinks: Amazing | Service: Good  Definitely try Mangoes! I've been twice, sat at the bar both times, and had a blast each time. I guess there's something about catching this spot at the right time; it feels like you've walked into a legit Jamaican/Caribbean restaurant.   This last visit we ate a little, drink a little more than we ate, and chatted it up with the Chef Frankie and others. The atmosphere was casual and relaxed. We ordered the jerk wings...delicious. Apparently, they make their jerk in house; the scotch bonnet comes through nicely.   Now for what we came for...the drinks. Ryan, the bartender, sure knows how to mix a drink. We ordered a couple of drinks off the menu; they were good. Then Ryan created a drink on the fly based on my boo telling him he liked tequila. I called it the Spider-Man, because Ryan climbed up the bar to pull down a couple of bottles and it was amazing.  We plan to come back for brunch. They have jerk chicken and waffles as a brunch offering. Looking forward to checking it out.

TbV8EXx9UG6DJz9FXdtqkw.text: Hands down best Caribbean style red snapper in Charlotte. As a chef I tend to not order seafood because it is almost always over cook and under seasoned. But its really good here. As a matter of fact I'm going tonight. The veggies curry roti is also very tasty. The staff here has always been very inviting every time I visit and that will always make a dining experience much more pleasurable. I will say do NOT order the food through Postmates or any food delivery service. It will not be the same experience.

nCWcJEkd9MOyAbDTqQbUzA.text: It's a no from me. My friend came into town and had heard good things about Mangos. So we went mid day on a Saturday. I had the Island chicken with green beans and French fries. I read somewhere that the fries were cooking in a garlic oil. They were not. There was a tiny smidge of a garlic and herb sauce that was on the fries (See photo). The beans were decent. The chicken was cut up in random pieces, dry, and bland. Fries were basic without sauce. Green beans were good. There's a mustard sauce for the chicken. It wasn't good.  My friend had curry goat, rice, and green beans. She thought her goat was a little chewy, but had decent flavor. Their cocktails were good.  Things went left with the tacos. First, the taco appetizer was $11.25. It came with three tacos and I couldn't help but think how I could go to Cabo Fish Taco and get an entire meal for the same price. The pictures on Yelp showed 3 tacos. The waitress said there would be 3 tacos. They come out and there are 2 tacos. Of course I point out the obvious and she says that it's the kitchen's choice. ????!??!?! So I asked to speak to management. He comes out and says that there are two because he was delivered larger tortillas and so there's more on each taco. The pictures looked the same size as on Yelp and the waitress just said there would be three. If there was a change of plans for today, she should have known. I told him I felt like we were being jipped. He finally conceded (almost as if it's not worth arguing) and sent out a 3rd taco. He wasn't rude about it, but didn't seem to understand that consistency and managing expectations in a restaurant is a big deal. The tacos were okay. Needless to say, I won't be back.

8mdPUAdEiVZ08WSXVWWyiA.text: Cheers to outstanding service, good food, and great prices!   Coming from Charleston we dont get to have too much of a Carribean option when it comes to going out to eat.  Traveling from near and far we found Noda to be the perfect spot to hang out hopping bar to shop Mangos appeared to be the most comfortable sit and eat!  The waitress was patient and personable, and we were even approached by the what i believed to be the co-owner of the restaurant. He was also quite kind, personable, professional, and hospitable!   Great spot to have delicious home styled meal.

TdqiO3Jz-Kr5arerbAWZMg.text: Don't waste your time! Yuck. The bartenders were not friendly. She thru napkins down on the bar and took our drink order (no hello, welcome, didn't inform us of the specials .... nada! ). The drinks were absolutely disgusting! I got a mixed drink that tasted like watered down melon liquor and my friend got a "Margarita" that was just sour mix and ice cubes. We asked to Switch our drinks out for beers, the bartender informed us that we could have a beer but would still be charged for the mixed drinks that we didn't drink!! We were shocked. They pointed out that it was literally printed  on the menu that there is "no refunds for mix drinks". Ummm what?! hello?! isn't this a sign that your bartenders are absolute garage if that many people have returned them & that's written on the menu?!?!!! My husband ordered a Unsweetened iced tea and of course got a sweetened one with a  comment "we don't even carry tea normally, todays your lucky day".... uhhh what? So they took off the $1.75 tea, leaving us with a $20 tab for 2 horrible drinks & lousy lousy service. Don't waste your time or money.

AEt2Lq3zcQBeoDElYSAC9Q.text: You can tell the cook is different. The food was not appealing today at all in taste. We ordered cabbage and oxtails with rice and peas. The soda was luke warm, the tea was sugar water. There was nothing authentic to the Caribbean at all and nothing like our last experience.  The owner was in the kitchen cooking the meals the last couple of time we came and today was a disappointment.

KE7wtLDI7xuCcB6spMgidg.text: Great food. Reasonable prices. Friendly helpful staff. The jerk chicken is divine and transported us back to Jamaica! Located in a really cool neighborhood.  Wasn't very busy, but not sure why.

iwk0xogEJpJj1cdsVjN0dg.text: After reading great reviews about Mangos, I decided to give them a try this past weekend.  Boy was I disappointed! They price gouge here. We were about to order and the waitress said the prices have gone up. I was so confused because  you are supposed to honor the prices on the menu. It went up $3 more. The quality and quantity of the food is not worth it! I got chicken and waffles in which I was supposed to get a leg and thigh. I received chopped up chicken bits, mainly bones and half a waffle. Wtf?!? For $12, I should've received a whole waffle and chicken. The food is not authentic. My friend ordered a $5 drink. The waitress said we don't have small glasses so we have to charge you for a large which is $10. What?! That's not our problem. Also, they added gratuity for a party of 3. They are ripping off people!.   Needless to say, I will not be returning. Don't waste your time or money.

_x07ixkqESQFkmAMDi7iaQ.text: Great curry goat and rice + peas. The portion was smaller than expected but packed with flavor. I should of asked to get the goat over the rice. Hard eating with 3 small dishes

EsqoijDHh9-ih60qadC6mw.text: I ordered brown stewed fish. I should've known something was wrong because it was cooked in less than 15 minutes. Brown stewed fish takes longer. My dinner had 2 pan seared fillet pieces with no stew gravy. I expected the whole fish with the head since it cost $20. I was too hungry to complain. The rice was mushy and the vegetables was scorched so badly that the broccoli was black. Whoever fixed my plate threw peppers on top to mask it. The rice and fish was well seasoned but I didnt eat blackened vegetables. This is not what I expected especially since the Yelp ratings are decent. I won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brown stewed fish with rice and peas and mixed veggies. The avocado is mine

kjJBCLTs7z4ky0e-9pZ-Iw.text: My husband and I have visited Mangos twice in the past week.  Our first experience was probably a 5.  We stopped in late one afternoon for a drink and an appetizer.  Our server was friendly and knowledgeable.  We had two cocktails and a serving of empanadas.  The drinks were fine and we really enjoyed the empanadas.  A 5*.  We visited again yesterday evening.  It seemed that our server had just been hired off the street.  We ordered a beer and a sangria, (no thing fancy here). 10 minutes later he finally brought them to the table (there was practically no one in the restaurant).  He asked if we had decided what we wanted to order.  We told him we never got a menu.  So he apologetically offered the menus from his pocket.  We ordered another two more beers.  After a few more minutes the server returned told us they had no more of the beerwe requested, and evidently their draft system was down. (?)    We ordered the chicken curry and the jerk pork with sides.  The chicken curry was very tasty, but the pork was not tender and was very fatty.  We ordered sides of the rice and beans, fruit and plantains.  Portions were generous. I don't think this place will make it with such poor service with all the other very fine restaurants around.

suKrfwEW76ixfBnOGakxzg.text: Anxiously waited almost 2 years for this spot to open and it didn't disappoint! 1st - atmosphere - welcome to the Caribbean mon! Music, colors, even the eliminated menu reminded me of spots I've visited in the Caribbean. It was very clean also.  2nd - service, very polite, friendly, informative (tall blonde waited on us, I think her name was Tracey? She was great.  3rd- drinks - so in my opinion this is going to be a great summer menu, I tried something called beat the heat I think - perfect for August weather on Theo back porch (which I took a peak at while there). Good selection, mostly rum drinks (that's to be expected but they had a full bar. 4th - Food - so just FYI the smell met us on the sidewalk and pulled us in. They have traditional Caribbean food - jerk chicken and pork, beans and rice, plantains, again expected - they also did a jerk chicken nacho. We got the empanadas ( 3 types) all were delicious! We also got the jerk wings - ended up ordering two orders - fall off the bone GOODNESS!!  I will def be going back. Someone already posted a pic of the menu on yelp so I won't repost as it's not available on their website at this time.

wrA7f_ulKaBzE7gqhCHJyQ.text: We came to Mango's on a double date. Our friends raved about it so we were excited to try it.  I'm not sure if it was an off night, but the waitress was not on her A game. She asked for our IDs (which was totally fine). I showed her my ID and she looked at me like I had 3 heads - she had totally forgotten that she had asked to see the IDs. Then she couldn't remember details about the menu.   My husband and I shared the half roasted chicken with rice and beans and plantains. We shared because our friends said it was plenty to share, I beg to differ. I thought the portions were pretty small for this type of fare. But, the prices were very fair.   The restaurant was very crowded on a Saturday night so they must be doing something right. I believe in second chances so we'll have to try it again, hopefully it was just an off night.

qtjKSH6SJgw_Odnly50xPw.text: Awesome Caribbean food.  Their scotch bonnet sauce is freaking awesome.  Their hushpupoues are awesome.  Their jerk chicken is awesome.  Everything is awesome.  Are you eating here right now?  Why not?  Get your ass over here?!?!  What is wrong with you?!?!?!  Jesus, I'm done with y'all.  Get yer asses here

T56C_sMeSMxYIXp9Z8zGwg.text: When we strolled into the eatery we were welcomed with a "Welcome to Mangos" and were situated right away. It didn't take long for our beverages to arrive and the nourishment pursued a couple of minutes after. Taste of the Oxtail...flavor was on, down deep down! Twitch Pork with Yuca/Cassava was so delicate, done to flawlessness. I adored the feel; decent for a little gathering to eat in. The mixed drinks are somewhat expensive.

L5r9NPWR3AmoxF7CuSecYQ.text: I have visited this place twice this week! Omg! I've never been a fan of Caribbean food but this place has changed my mind. On my first visit I had the curry chicken, green beans and fried plantains. On my second visit, I shared a whole red snapper, black beans and fried plantains. On both visits I had the amazing Tracy as my waitress. You know, good service can make a good restaurant Great! She was pleasant, knowledgeable able to make recommendations! Now back to the food! Everything was seasoned just right. The spice level was just what I asked for. I will be heading back there this summer.

photos.caption: Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Whole snapper for two!
Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

_GPC_8c8Ycb1NMlFAIbkRQ.text: The drinks are disgusting and be aware you cannot respectfully ask for something different because "the manager is very stern on alcohol being final sale." The food and the flies...

AomWUCUJt6BpiN-Q5X7PWQ.text: I'm giving 3 stars because every time I visit Mango's the food is always inconsistent. Why can't it taste as good as it did my 1st visit!!! They tend to run out of one or two items and this is not a good look! The best food item on the menu is the Island Charcoal Chicken or the Red Snapper!!!

jii41Ijk9eotBdZlO1Z7Yw.text: I came here on Easter and I have to say......the food was excellent!!!! Their menu of Caribbean food is great and taste amazing. The alcoholic beverage menu is very creative and full of life and the vibe of the  restaurant  was great. Definitely will come here again.   The restaurant prices are decent, not too expensive.  And the customer service is phenomenal. If your looking for a good Caribbean vibe, this is the place to be.   My recommended plate: jerk chicken with rice and beans and fried plantains.

_cIEbXuIDPJHJM68pdiJSQ.text: Yummy!  This gem in Noda has some amazing food. The lunch special is what I had - curry chicken, plantains and cabbage.  The chicken was soft and well seasoned, the plantains were crisp exactly how I like them. The cabbage was ok - could have used some extra seasoning but overall an awesome dining experience for the money. I'd definitely come back! The decor is lively and the music was awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

QuuHC2oR8bpqnNENxDsijA.text: The food was AMAZING! The red snapper is good and this time I had the jerk chicken! Very well seasoned! So so soooooo good!

photos.caption: Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jerk Chicken

Ru3-f6ft9UhQMdMCczRItg.text: Just happened upon this restaurant while walking in Noda, and it was a happy, fun, tasty, colorful dining experience.  Started with the sangria, perfect on a hot day.  My husband enjoyed a goat dish, and I got an assortment of sides (beans and rice, plantains, colorful mango slaw, and collards).  We will be back!

mm74KNPuzp0eNW_LFc7i4w.text: I came to Mangos on June 30 for brunch and they also had a DJ and was a promoted event. This was the worst service I've ever received. It took close to 20 minutes for our waiter to even come to the table. This was after initially waiting 30 minutes to be seated. He never offered us water. It took over an hour for our food to come. It was clear that our waiter, Cody, had some personal problems going on. I spoke to the promoter who tried his best to help with the situation. Things worsened when he finally gave us our checks and took over 30 minutes to scan our cards. I asked the promoter to speak to the manager who insinuated that it wasn't the best idea, which clearly is apart of the problem. While the food was slightly better than average the service was horrendous. To top it off, when everything was straightened out, they have the audacity to incorporate gratuity into their total for parties over 4 people.   The promoter stated that Mangos is the only black owned restaurant on the block. It saddens me to say that if this establishment continues to give subpar service and the managers continue to dodge patron complaints, this restaurant will not be on the block much longer.  Y'all wasted my time and played with my money. Do better.

qcOuBsA85yg3YNKCHZZaew.text: I wanted to give Mango's a try since it has a lot of good reviews...that was a mistake.  The chicken was OK, but very overpriced for what you get.  Not sure I've ever seen a quarter chicken that small.  The sides were awful...all of them were super dry. The service was OK, but we were really thrown off when they automatically included a 15-20% tip for a table of two.  Will definitely never go back.

2pejLeLayjG0nc_SIk2Wsg.text: I was so excited to eat here for my birthday dinner because I LOVE Caribbean food! I was beyond disappointed! The waitress disappeared and took forever to come back to ask our order. I ordered a drink and that took FOREVER to bring it, apparently the bartender disappeared. I got fish fritters for my app and they were SUPER salty. I ordered jerk shrimp and the cabbage was super bland, not a drop of salt or pepper. Not going back.

bMSCAOi3P-rjP1BcL6XG5A.text: My husband & I ate here one evening & the food is just ok. The staff is nice ...portions are very small tho. If you want real YAWD food go to Caribbean hut. If you know you know.

photos.caption: Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

5IDMfI7-Y__BSW5XH-Zl3A.text: I just had THE BEST Veggie Roti!!!!!!! The food was fresh and the flavor was amazing. The Roti bread was really good. I love the atmosphere and there are always drunk specials. They are open late which is a plus in Noda!

lYWfH8VVFAOWh2qNZwtvCg.text: It was best restaurant my wife and I had been in a long time. She had jerk pork. I had the curry chicken. Both dishes were so flavorful and delicious. We also drink ginger beer and a another soda from Jamaica. And for dessert we had henney cake. Oh man that henney cake is the best next to my wife's rum cake. We have now found a new tradition for the day after a concert. Lunch at this restaurant. If you haven't tried it you are missing out on something special.

EelwQKNT-DC_Hqm7JI41Ow.text: Just stopped by for lunch with my wife. She had the curry chicken and I had the jerk chicken. We both enjoyed our entrees, but the tostones were really greasy and that's all I could taste. The prices are super cheap for lunch. I wouldn't suggest going if you're in a rush they seemed to be a bit understaffed and there were only 3 tables and our food still took 30 minutes.

photos.caption: Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jerk Chicken Lunch Entree, tostones, and yellow rice
Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Curry chicken lunch entree with cabbage and rice and peas

sgi0hee7OKl-J4-JE7J0CQ.text: Not as advertised.  A free lunch for federal workers was advertised, so we went, appreciative of the show of support during this shutdown. Five of us went, three of us are federal workers, the other two were my kids.  Upon asking for the check-- I expected to pay for my kids, and the others expected to be charged for the drinks they ordered-- we were told, "Oh, it isn't free, it's only $10 off."  It would have been nice to have been informed of that when we produced our identification prior to ordering, or any specifics regarding the offer (image attached). Additionally, a gratuity was charged on the bill for two adults and two children, as well as on the bill for the single individual.   Predatory advertising, and poor communication. Not a place I'll be patronizing again.

photos.caption: Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nextdoor advertisement that was not upheld.

pp_Pg-RNJr792vbvT5uq-Q.text: We visited Mango's for the first time on Valentine's Day.  We walked in a little before 7 pm and were seated immediately.  (Just as an fyi - by the time we left around 8:30, the restaurant was nearly full.)  Our server greeted us and went over the special for the evening (salmon and scallops - yum!!) and let us know that Wednesdays are half-price bottles of wine.  (I already knew this, as it was a major factor in our decision to try them out.)  Their wine bottles max out around $38 - so, you're really getting a deal here.  We ordered the malbec - and liked it so much we got a 2nd bottle later in the evening.  We started with the shrimp ceviche - served in a margarita glass and chips in a cigar box.  The presentation was great, and the flavor was even better - sweet and spicy.  I ordered the salmon/scallops special and my husband got the whole red snapper pan-seared.  The food far exceeded expectations - it was cooked and seasoned perfectly.   The owner stopped by our table to introduce himself and made sure to catch us on our way out to thank us for dining with them.  We enjoyed ourselves in every way - I'm excited to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Whole red snapper pan-seared
Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon and scallops special
Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp ceviche

MtaBMcOkGBmhzjYrfnjCUw.text: We were visiting Charlotte on buisness and wanted local cuisine and Mango did not disappoint.  We had the snapper with beans and rice, roasted veggies, plantains.  Round out dinner with the rum cake and sorrel drink. Boy.... this place is a must! Food was delicious... Service was excellent.  Cody made us feel at home.  Overall, this was a very memorable meal.

0KNn56AxXO57L230jpLYug.text: The food and customer service was great. The red snapper is wonderful, the sides r great. I will most def be back to try the other dishes.

TATSMZBdy6CMrOhhdfaLPA.text: The service was so poor that even if the food was fabulous, we would not have enjoyed it. It took 15 minutes for anyone to come to the table and over an hour for our food to come. When it came, it was cold. We just wanted a quick bite because we had limited time, but, alas, it was a 2 hour ordeal. And it was super hot in the dining room.

WYo1ujIO8D9_je0lcbvGNw.text: This place has so much potential and I cannot wait to see grow. I've heard about this place when it was first opening up and of course being a fan of Caribbean food it was on my list of places to try. At first, I heard a lot of mixed reviews though to the point that I held off. While I'm the area, my bf and I were in search of a place to have brunch when we drove past a place that was packed and see there was a live DJ playing some of our favorite songs when I realized it was Mango's I told him today should definitely be the day that we try it. I won't lie for the amount of space they had adding the DJ made it extremely loud and a bit hard to talk with your party. I ordered the tropical fish and grits with a side of scrambled eggs. The food ended up being good but the eggs tasted a little funny maybe because of the way they cooked them (it's not your traditional scrambled eggs). The only other thing I noticed was that although our service was decent a lot of the servers were arguing with each other. I would constantly hear the bartender threaten servers that if they didn't do (blank) today would be their last day and they were getting fired. I don't know how serious she was but definitely don't think that's a way to carry yourself around customers

lTrTc2xwUoCLlaCeQoWz6g.text: The service was exceptional. The food we enjoyed was authentic and delicious. We started with chicken empanadas. Our lunch entrees were jerk chicken and curry chicken. Hubby and I both thought the food was incredibly delicious. And it wasn't heavy. We felt great after eating. We will be back!

veBILbF1MXJd6w_sYLs55A.text: I just stopped in one evening for a drink and it was an A-Ok experience!  The bartender was very friendly, greeted us right away, went over the menu.  The restaurant was basically empty when I came in.  It was a weeknight, early in the week, and a little late also.    I had a mango mojito, and while it was really delicious, the price was not appealing.  I'm not sure if they have drink specials or happy hour throughout the week, but they definitely need to.  Very pricey!  They brought out some chips and a salsa mix, which was amazingly delicious.  The chips were fresh and hot.  I may come back to try food soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mojito-Mango

FKwTmYSkDcapXAeMolRenA.text: Mango's is lowkey one of my favorite restaurants in NoDa. Coming from Miami, I ate A LOT of Caribbean food and hell, I'm half Puerto Rican so I know some shi- but Mango's really comes through for me when I have a craving.   Every single time that I have gone, the service was more than friendly. I've been here on numerous occasions with my boyfriend, brought family here when they visited in town, ordered from them on DoorDash.. you get the point.   Food wise:  The jerk chicken wings are a must!  I've had their Oven Roasted Chicken, Jerk Chicken, Oxtail, Snapper.. all were phenomenal. I don't know how you can go wrong with anything that you order from here. Honestly, the cooks do such a great time. I think out of the many, many times that I have ordered here only once did the food not turn out right and it wasn't even a huge misstep. Just chicken drier that normal and again, that was 1/10.   So if you're looking for some great home cooked Caribbean type of meal.. this is the place to be.   Pro Tip:  They have Salsa nights on Friday nights. It's so much fun to be eating, dancing, drinking the night away while you're dining. Eat in plenty and dance off those carbs haha! They'll teach you basic Salsa, Merengue and Bachata steps too!

4gR5Pxg3LO3Tccp4gDzrAw.text: Everything about the reviews are TRUE. Food is on POINT !!!! No question.   The Front STAFF : just sad  Let's get into it .....   At 11:25 6 workers on the floor. It's Saturday night!! Restaurant not busy. (@this time) Check the videos for evidence.   Tables are dirty wait staff must have a Fitbit on because all they do is walk in circles. It's actually funny/sad of how they actually don't take notice of how much money they are losing.   It's been over a 30 min wait for chicken wings for a app. 40 mins for a drink when the bartender was my waitress.   Tables are dirty.   It's now 12:02 -still no food only order . Nachos wings jerk chicken plate order.   However THE FOOD WAS ON POINT. I GIVE THE KITCHEN 5

9IFsTNKzRJP8h-98qkbRiw.text: Every single person I asked about Jamaican food in Charlotte said to try Mangos. I would just like to say, I was very underwhelmed by the food.  The service was pretty slow. They had two servers on a Sunday who had to take care of the tables, bar, and to go orders. My food took over 30 minutes.  I ordered the oxtails (that came with two sides) along with a side order of rice. My main hesitation when ordering oxtails is that you won't get enough bang for your buck. That was definitely True in this case. I've never seen beans in oxtails which just seemed like filler to give you less of the main course.   Individually Scored: Oxtails: 3/5 Rice: 3/5 Macaroni: 3.5/5 Cabbage: 0/5  The cabbage was too crunchy and too underseasoned for my taste; it honestly lacked flavor. Everything else was edible, but I told my roommate that I wouldn't go back. Also, my meal was $22 which was another reason I'm good on it. Hopefully I can find some good and generous Jamaican spots here in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Oxtails, yellow rice, and macaroni
Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cabbage

SukNlvnUXwE2i9-fPszfyw.text: So i tried this place with the family and because soo many of my yep friends raved over the great food. Unfortunately I was not impressed at all and I ordered a LOT of food, $70.00 worth to be exact.   I didn't capture a photo of everyone's food but here's what we ordered.  Me - jerk chicken with red beans and rice and collard greens. I did not receive you red bean and rice and the rice I had was over cooked and extremely dry.   Mom - Asian chicken wings and salad. The wings were under cooked and the salad was SO BASIC!   Granny - Salad with chicken added, her salad was basic also with a few strips of chicken breast added. Certainly not worth the $16.   Cousin - Empanadas and red beans and rice, again they did not give her the red beans and rice either as she requested.   Nephew - Hamburger and fries, he's burger was burger and hard on the bread.  We did not noticed any of this u til we made it home as we ordered our food to go. Seeing as though we lived on the other side of town we did not return the food. But I won't return to this establishment it was not good at all.

Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jerk Classic Chicken with 2 Sides

K3WkKhUmQBlRN89jk2g7-w.text: I dated a Jamaican a while ago. I think I stayed with him much longer than I should have because of his cooking. Jesus! That man could throw down in the kitchen! Preparing Jamaican dishes takes lots of time and attention and Mango's gets it all the way right.  I don't have one negative thing to say about this place. My jerk shrimp with rice and beans is a dish I'll remember for a very long time and use to compare many other Jamaican dishes in my future. For realz. So authentic. So flavorful. So delicious it has me reminiscing. I may have to even call up my Jamaican friend just to say "hi."  Well, maybe not that good but close.

photos.caption: Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jerk shrimp was super yummy!!

tlI6b1LGwm4CoMWZTM68pQ.text: St patricks.day Jerk Chicken and Waffles brunch. So no I wasn't eating corned beef and other Delicacies that are normally attributed to Saint Patrick's Day. I went to the top, and the jerk chicken who was delightful. This is my first visit to Mangos and I found your location to be colorful, tropical authentic and a nice spot to sit back and listen to some great music. On the other side is service. The waitress that waited on me was great, but terribly overworked, she needed some help for a outings such as this one. Waffles, waffles, waffles. Let's talk about the waffles. Mine's were delightful, light and fluffy, leaving me only with the desire to have more. The Jerk Chicken was spiced well, but as one that likes it hot and spicy I could have used a little more jerk seasoning. All in all this was a great experience and I will return the mangoes to try some of the other dishes especially their fried plantains.

photos.caption: Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jerk chicken and waffles Sunday...
Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

wri0m1hTPeoXLKT7ypMLYA.text: Worst restaurant in Charlotte I've been to since I've started living here in 2013.   Went with a friend tonight. Got roasted chicken.  I tried to make it work with the sauce they provided.  It was inedible-- chicken tasted fishy due to the oil that was reused.    Staff proceeded to tell me they couldn't make a mixed drink because their vendor didn't deliver the soda.  Cool no problem.   Brought me out a watered down ginger ale.  And then returned a few mins later and I let him know the ginger ale was watered down and flat.   He the returns and proceeds to tell me the vendor made the delivery and that they got the coke for the mixed drink.  And brings the mixed drink without asking me.  I'm not sure what it was, but it was most definitely not Coke.    Not sure how they got a delivery of soda at night all of a sudden.   Then get charged for an item they forgot to bring me. And when the food was so bad, I politely said, if I could cancel the one side dish, since they forgot about it.  The gentleman brought it out anyway, and the item was cold, soggy--again, didn't touch a bite.   The waiter literally carried away all my food at the end,  virtually uneaten, and didn't ask a question.   Then when I got my change after I paid, staff proceeds to tell me they would have to go next door if I wanted all my change back.    The quality of the food is subpar, as well as the service.   Maybe I ordered the wrong items, and maybe it was a bad day for the restaurant.  Who knows...  Cheers-

dE3O2c8zmxUnGvjXk-FUtQ.text: Just went here on a Friday night and the service was HORRIBLE. My friend recommended it to me coming before in the past and her having a good experience.  Something was completely off with me visiting with her again.   The place was not that packed and we were quickly seated. Our waitress initially was quick was taking our orders and then everything went downhill. It took 10-15 to even get our waters that we ordered. We also ordered some appetizers (we got here at about 8:30pm). Going on 9:00 our appetizers still had not come. We ended up telling the waitress to cancel the appetizers and take them off our tab because at this point they were just going to be coming out with our main course which is not the point of an appetizer. She maybe refilled our waters once the whole time we were there.   We eventually got our food about 45 mins later around 9:15pm. It honestly took so much for me not to walk out, however I noticed everyone else in the restaurant was having issues too. Our waitress was the ONLY waitress in the whole building they only had one.. on a Friday night.   Me and my friend both got the Jerk Chicken, rice, and plantains. The food was really really good. The jerk seasoning was done well and not deathly hot. They left the chicken on the bone which was good for juiciness, but kind of annoying with having to pick bones out as you eat it. The plantains were cooked to perfection. The rice was just regular yellow rice.   Sad that the food was good , but the service was so bad I wouldn't come back. I overheard I am assuming who was the manager say they only had one cook and one waitress (who was new) which makes no sense to me. The one waitress looked very stressed and like she was going to breakdown at any moment.   If you want to take a risk on the service then go for it. Won't catch me going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jerk chicken, plantains, and yellow rice.

As1J0qYilzlptC2-eQKjaQ.text: This place is really good. If you like island eats then this is the place for you. My sister and I went in for dinner one night. She got the roasted chicken and I got the fish fritters. Everything was really flavorful. I also ordered a side of plantains, which are my favorite, and they were great. I really like the atmosphere of this place. I saw families and friends gathered together so it has a good family feel. If island cuisine is your flavor then this place is for you.

erUILQ1wN84eZabf_AdNIg.text: We wanted to try something different in NODA. So we decided on this place. As soon as we walked in I had a bad feeling. It was dead. And NODA was busy as usual. Especially since this was PRIDE weekend.  The hostess was at best indifferent and seemed to be bothered by the fact customers had walked in. After we sat down we decided to start with chips and salsa. So glad we did that! After TEN minutes of waiting we left. If you can't get chips and salsa correct can you get anything correct?

YdN3x4HJgh6xsB8R_i1TsA.text: I have been walking past this place in NODa so many times & never paid it any attention. Shame on me lol this place is soooo good. I checked review & pics on yelp before trying it & the reviews on the wait time being really long was True, however the waiter I had was very attentive & he made sure to keep our drinks coming & provided good conversation which helped make the time go by fast. The food was delicious & we got a good portion. I would most definitely recommend this place. If you have the patience to wait you will be happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jerk Classic Chicken with 2 Sides

jAuijcUvy2TsUZKL30hmcQ.text: I've been to Mango's three times! Once for lunch, Sunday brunch, and Saturday night dinner. The food taste really good, but I would say I couldn't compare it to other Caribbean restaurants in regards to recipes. I think one of the biggest differences I notice are the seasonings and the food not necessarily being as smothered in sauce. The rice also has more of a drier, firm texture than moist (based off of three visits). It is still tasty but different! However, their oxtails are everything and more. Oh my!!! And their tropical fish and grits for lunch. Yassss!!!  Last night, I was able to try the caesar salad too and added shrimp. It comes with 4 shrimp and grilled pita slices (I think thats what it was) drizzled in caesar dressing. It fulfilled my needs for last night but I would recommend the lettuce being properly drained. I could tell the lettuce was just washed as much of the water was in the bottom of my plate causing my dressing to thin out. I would also recommend more of the green pieces of lettuce because much of it was left on my plate being that it consisted of the hard pieces of lettuce. I call it the spine of romaine lettuce.  Other than that, this is definitely still a restaurant you don't want to miss. Despite my recommendations, I obviously still enjoy it as I've been three times and will continue to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red Sangria!!! Sunday Brunch
Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Caesar Salad (add shrimp)
Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sunday Brunch Menu

jaXEWBDBCqWda4R0076BLQ.text: Wow this place really is just throwing me way off meaning I was not expecting such great food for such a quiet restaurant. Mangos probably has one of the best carribean food in Charlotte. Meat is just fall off the bone tender and the flavor is just perfect.   Appetizer I ordered the tropical hush puppies, they were good the tropical sauce that you dip into was good.I would definitely order again they just didn't really blow my mind.   Now here is where the money is at the Entree. I had the Jerk chicken and it really had the right balance of spice to it, not too hot but just the right amount of heat to remind you who really was the Jerk that ordered the dish. It came with 2 sides I opted for the fried plantains I mean fried bananas how can you go wrong seriously, they were fried perfectly and that sweet sweet flavor damn they were good! I also had the roasted veggies again squash, zucchini, carrots, peppers, & onions all just cooked perfectly nothing soggy or over cooked you can tell it was all just fresh veggies they used. I'm sure I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Damn those were some good veggies!
Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Who&#39;s the Jerk now Jerk Chicken

RWUGMmjfYfVWC_DkcsLTIg.text: I ate here during a Jerk Chicken n' Waffles Brunch event. The menu is markedly different than what they serve during non event times, but I still wanted to share the deliciousness of what I ate!   The French toast wasn't dry and it was kinda fluffy. It was really good. I also ordered a sort of curry vegetarian wrap  with an assortment of veggies with waffle fries. If y'all reading this, y'all need to have this as a regular item on the menu. I looked at the menu that is posted online, but I didn't see it. That. Wrap. Was. So. Good.   Also, those mimosas were good and strong. This place was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

GD1SgRDKhGQLcj7DQipijQ.text: I wanted Mangos to be a favorite but it looks like we have a flag on the play. Here's the deal. You can not consider yourself a worthy establishment, yet lack consistency. Consistently is not difficult, especially if you have a head chef and the same recipe. This is why I am baffled by the inconsistency of chicken curry roti, as evidenced by my posted photos.   The first time it was perfect. The second time it was completely different and quite oily. I also ordered the cabbage which was so undercooked that I had to send it back. Consider the fact that I appreciate an al dente vegetable, and it was still undercooked even for me. Not to add, lacking flavor.   I stayed because I was starving. If such was not the case, I would have left.   The only factor that encourages me to return is the fact that the manager was accommodating. Of our party of 3, 2 people were greatly displeased with their meal. He was gracious enough to comp most of my meal and all of my guest's meal. He also received the constructive feedback and committed to communicate with the chef.   I will give Mangos another shot.

Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Curry Chicken Roti (Buss Up) &amp; Cabbage

Zuv_iOP8BpWsHAxnvhZwPg.text: Today was my first time here. We came here for a day party and brunch. It was a REALLY nice vibe. It took a little while for our waiter to come over to greet us but he was really cool and apologized for the delay.  My husband and I both ordered the jerk chicken and waffles and saltfish fritters as an appetizer. My husband is from Jamaica he said they were not authentic but good. I agreed. They were very tasty.   Our main course came out fast. My pet peeve is when I am served waffles or pancakes without syrup. So we had to wait about 5 minutes or so to get syrup. Once we got the syrup it was cold (maybe room temperature) this did not bother my husband but it bothered me because my food had already cooled down and now I am putting cold syrup on it.  My husband got the rum punch and it was really good and sweet. We will definitely be back to give this restraunt another try. Oh and the day party was a hit and the DJ and hype man were excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. This place has a really cool vibe.

ciAXVXmOxmJJSAeP-Sj1TA.text: Stopped by on a Wednesday evening, which wine bottles are 1/2 off! Yay! Started with the fish fritters and empanadas. The salted fish fritters were not for me. I didn't taste the fish at all, it was very eggy and doughy for me. They had a good flavor coating the outside of them though. Huge empanadas! These were a little well done and the chef knew that, so without evening asking we were brought out two more perfectly done ones. And they were delicious!   I got the jerk chicken platter with a side of plantains and rice. The chicken was so flavorful! Loved all the spices and little kick it had. I ate all my rice and I sooo wanted more! Watch for bones in all chicken dishes! Plantains were cooked perfectly.   I left stuffed and with half my dinner for the next day. Cute little spot in the heart of NoDa.

photos.caption: Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Empanadas- a little well done but the chef brought out two others for us
Photo of Mango's Caribbean Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fritters

TOEksutX6wVQDBpOsOjlNA.text: Wow. Wow. Wow. I've never been to a Caribbean restaurant like this. It's more of Caribbean fusion and I like it. I love it. The restaurant design, music , and food all give you island vibes; very comfortable dining area and bar inside. The waitstaff were very friendly, and I found the menu had a lot to choose from including a special brunch menu for the weekend.   From the brunch menu I chose a seafood wrap with breakfast potatoes. The wrap was to come in a green wrap with scallops , but they were out of this by the the time I arrived. The chef was courteous enough to come out and explain what other seafood he had and could include and let me know it was going to come on a white wrap.   He could have kept this info to himself, because what he brought me was exceptionally good. Generous portions of seafood, swimming in spice and sauce ( but not to much sauce) with tasty veggies mixed. The wrap was grilled to perfection and the bread was fine. The wrap was so large I couldn't finish I all , but it reheated well at home the next day.  I HIGHLY recommend you try Mango's if you really want something with a lot of flavor .

dlN4qnEyeNMnlPQsv5vCkA.text: Finally getting around to rating Mango's after several trips. Went to MCR during its initial opening and the one consistent thing was the food was great. The waiter I had on opening day must have been a friend of the owner filling in cause it wasn't the best but over the course of my visits the service has gotten better and better.  During my last visit, this has to have been the best yet. Our waiter was just this cool guy who knew his liquor, made some great recommendations to one of my friends on food and was very attentive/personable.  So on to food  Food again has been very consistent over the course of my visits, never had an issue. I'm a curry chicken guy which I've had so many times from other restaurants & authentically made & MCR can definitely hang with the big boys. Friends ordered a few other dishes and they mentioned it being to spicy so I would suggest asking about spice level if you're not a spice person. Mine was spiced perfectly.  If you're looking for good Caribbean food and in the NODA neighborhood stop by MCR for a plate and a cocktail you won't be disappointed. They have live music from time to time and the crowd is pretty live here I means it's a Caribbean spot so come for the food and stay for the experience. Can be pretty loud if you're looking for a romantic outing so sit on the patio for a little privacy/quiet.  FYI - They have a very cute outdoor area.
